DOC.HEAD: Typhoon Downgraded to Tropical Depression
DOC.TEXT: Typhoon Jack weakened rapidly Thursday to tropical depression status and no longer posed a threat to this U.S. territory or any other islands in the western Pacific, weather officials said. Jack's sustained winds, which had been clocked as high as 135 mph Tuesday, fell to 30 mph by 11 a.m. Thursday, according to the Joint Typhoon Warning Center. In eight hours on Thursday, Jack went from typhoon status, with winds of at least 74 mph, to a tropical storm, with winds from 39 to 73 mph, to a tropical depression, with winds less than 39 mph, the center said. At last report, Jack was 220 miles southeast of Guam and slowly drifting south and unlikely to re-form into a threatening storm, forecasters said.
